page.title: 11Public houses in Swindon.
page.content: In Old Town there are many public houses and clubs. People go there to meet their friends and have a drink or a meal. The Pubs are the Royal Oak, Bell, King's Arms, Plough, wheatsheaf, Fountain, Victoria, Cross-keys, Globe, and Prince of Wales. The Clubs are the Working Man's club, Club 4, Liddington club. Many of the Pubs were built over 100 years ago for travellers. They have been modernised and are very popular with local people. In New Swindon there are many more pubs and clubs. The newest ones are in the Westward expansion and some of these are most unusual,such as a Spanish Hacienda, and a Village complete with Blacksmith's forge.
